boardgame.name: Joraku
上洛
boardgame.description: Joraku is an ancient Japanese word commonly used before the Edo period which means _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Going to Kyoto_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo;._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Specifically, during the Sengoku period, Joraku refers to the act of local warlords, the Daimyo, marching their armies toward Kyoto to _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;protect the Shogun and Emperor from other rogue lords_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; and ultimately rule in their place._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Onward to Kyoto! Take command of your army, and defeat every Daimyo blocking the way! March on! To victory! March on! Kachidoki!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Joraku is a trick-taking area control game. Outwit your opponents with tactical card play, use your loyal Samurais to bid control of areas and build prestige. Only the Daimyo with the highest reputation and the biggest stick can rule Japan!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Round Overview_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Recruit Phase_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Draw new hand of 5(6) skirmish cards in a 4(3) player game. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Pass 2 cards to the left simultaneously._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Skirmish Phase_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Each player plays 1 card and resolves it. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Check who wins this skirmish._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Pass the Kachidoki card to winner. All players rank influence where the winner's Daimyo token is to gain RP._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Repeat 1~3 until all cards in hand are played._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Prestige Phase:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Rank influence of players in each area, earn Reputation Points based on the score charts on the map._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game lasts for 3 rounds, and the player with the highest RP wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The points given in each area will be different for every round. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Your Samurai cubes will stay on the map between rounds, so plan for the future when you place them._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
